DOC.brief_summary: Femur fractures are a common injury in the Pediatric population. Despite their high incidence little do we know about the long term implications on the bones' length. Our main goal is to clarify this obscure issue by assessing the femoral and tibial length as determined by the fractures, measuring techniques and treatment modalities
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of the Change in Length of the Leg in Children After Treatment of Femur Fractures.
DOC.criteria: Males between the ages 016. Females between the ages 014. Signed Informed consent A refusal by the patient or his legal guardian to continue the followup with the Pediatric Orthopedic clinic, or to have the CT scanograms. Patients with severe contractures in the lower extremities Patients with multiple lower extremity fractures Pregnancy
